sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Tecumbo Silako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has officially backed Ukraine's bid to join the EU, but its candidate status comes with a long list of conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The UK government has ordered the extradition of the Wikileaks founder Julian Assange to the United States where he faces spying charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And after a US federal judge says Donald Trump presented a clear and present danger to democracy over his attempt to overturn the US 2020 election, we'll examine the evidence at the latest Congressional Committee hearing. The leaders of France, Germany, Italy and Romania have backed Ukraine's efforts to join the European Union

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: during talks with the country's president in Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Brussels will be giving its opinion on Kiev's membership to the bloc later today, which it is expected to recommend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But French President Emmanuel Macron stressed that the path to EU membership will take time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This signal must be sent now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yes, we're ready to recognize Ukraine as a candidate country, but we told them all together with the same frankness this process will take time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There will be conditions. There will be a roadmap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz pointed to the importance of preventing the war from escalating and potentially causing a clash between NATO and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I am doing what I was sworn to do as German Chancellor, and in this case this means specifically supporting Ukraine so it can defend its integrity and sovereignty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That is what we want to bring forward together, and at the same time it's always about preventing an escalation of the war so that it won't result in fighting between nato and russia and we can all agree on that the trip to kiev has been seen as a move to stave off criticism as the french italian and german leaders have all been accused of not taking a strong enough stance in their support of ukraine's fight against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Later today, the EU Commission is also set to decide the fate of Moldova and Georgia in their efforts to join the bloc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin has surely watched this visit extremely closely,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: and there were some comments from Moscow that made me think that to see all of those leaders in Kiev to see this overwhelming support to Ukraine was extremely annoying to Moscow so the deputy head of Russia's Security Council Dmitry Medvedev actually mocked this visit in his Twitter account. warned that the clock was ticking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And earlier, Medvedev wrote in his telegram that in the nearest future, Ukraine may disappear from the world map.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And there was another signal, let's say, coming from Moscow today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The gas supplies were lowered down via Nord Stream pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They were reduced by Russia. Gazprom says that the official reason is some problems with the equipment deliveries from Canada. And the Russian ambassador to the EU said that if those problems are not solved, Russia could suspend definitely gas supplies via this pipeline. But some analysts indeed think that this is a clear message.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least three civilians were killed and seven wounded in a Russian airstrike on Lysychansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This is the report of the governor of the Luhansk region, who adds that the bombs fell on a building where many people had sought refuge, while others were trying to be evacuated. Lysychansk is the twin city of Severodonetsk, where a key battle for the future of Donbass is being fought. In the Severodonetsk region, Russian occupiers continue firing against the units of our troops from all of their available weapons in the areas of the settlements of Belohorivka, Lichansk and Sverodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The enemy does not attempt to establish full control over the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It continues the assault. The fighting continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A combat costly in lives and with no signs of ending in the short term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In its daily war report, the Russian Defense Ministry claims the Russian army has eliminated over 280 Ukrainian servicemen in the Donetsk. Ukrainian authorities speak of heavy casualties on both sides. In addition to human losses, Russia claims to have destroyed two Ukrainian command posts, two multiple rocket launching systems, one Su-25 aircraft, six tanks and three ammunition depots.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Slavyansk, in the neighbor Indonesk region, soldiers are keeping a close eye on what is happening in Luansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Full control of Severodonetsk could give the Russians access to the rest of the area and link up with the troops they already have in the south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Between February and the end of April, Mariupol was likely the deadliest place in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That's how UN human rights chief Michel Bachelet described the devastated strategic port city now held by Moscow. Bachelet has been giving an update to the UN Human Rights Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: To date, OCHR has verified 1,348 individual civilian deaths directly in hostilities in Mariupol, including 70 children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: These deaths were caused by airstrikes, tank and artillery shelling, and small arms and light weapons during street fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The actual death toll of hostilities on civilians is likely thousands higher.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: UN monitors, who were unable to access Mariupol due to the security situation gathered information from people who had left the city and from satellite imagery. Many were killed by shelling while others burned or were suffocated in fires which could not be extinguished due to a lack of available fire services. Due to a shortage of drinking water, people took long, dangerous trips to wells or open reservoirs to procure such water as could be found.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Others were forced to melt snow or to drink water extracted from cars or other equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After three months, Russia took control of Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Bachelet says conditions in the city are dire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: She says residents have limited access to medical care and other basic services and that people cannot leave and return freely. She also warned that the horrors inflicted on the civilian population will leave their indelible mark on generations to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Let's give you some more details on one of our top stories now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The British government has ordered the extradition of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to the United States where he's facing spying charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Home Secretary, Priti Patel, signed the extradition order earlier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Her department said it follows a British court ruling in April that Assange could be sent to the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Home Office said in a statement that the UK courts have not found that it would be oppressive, unjust or an abusive process to extradite Assange. He is now likely to appeal. We'll bring you more on this story as we get it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The head of Russian energy giant Gazprom has declared it will play by its own rules after cutting daily gas supplies to Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Alexei Miller was talking during a panel discussion at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Our product, our rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We don't play by rules we didn't make.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He also made it clear he blamed the current energy crisis on the West and Europe in particular.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are witnesses to shocks to gas prices. We are witnesses to super high volatility on the raw materials markets and very high inflation. But all this did not begin yesterday nor today. And here we must say a very big thank you to foreign regulators, especially European regulators. Earlier this week, Gazprom slashed its natural gas deliveries via the Nord Stream pipeline, adding to the pressure on Germany and others to find replacement sources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Gazprom claims it was due to delayed repair work, but European leaders say it was political.
